member.name: M:AvlNet.GenICam.GigEVision_TryReceiveImage(System.Int32,System.Int32,AvlNet.Image@)
member.summary: Receives next frame from video stream.
member.param: Handle of an opened device that is streaming video.

Image buffer that will receive a new frame.

member.summary: This function performs enumeration of network devices and returns a list of present device descriptors.

member.param: Path identifying provider library to limit enumeration to. Default value: atl::NIL, or null.
String identifying communication interface to limit enumeration to. Default value: atl::NIL, or null.
Name of interface transport technology to limit enumeration to. Default value: atl::NIL, or null.
Time limit, in milliseconds, that the function will wait for device response on each enumerated interface.
Returns a list with device list descriptors.

member.summary: Converts a string to a GigEVision device address.

Name of GenICam command node to access.
Specifies how filter checks inActivation input. Default value: WhenTrue.
Activates execution of command. Default value: True.
True to verify GenICam command parameter access state before every command execution. Default value: True.

member.summary: Checks if device sent event notification since previous iteration.

member.summary: Retrieves basic statistics of video streaming out of GigEVision device.

Number of received valid frames that were put into the input queue.
Number of all frames that the device should have sent but were not retrieved by the application.
Number of received valid frames that were lost because of input queue overflow.
Number of frames that were partially received but were discarded because of data damage.
Number of frames currently held in the input queue.
Number of times the device was requested to resend some parts of lost frames.
Number of network packets that were expected but not retrieved.
Number of times the connection with the device was lost and automatically reestablished.
